Key Arguments: Words can cause harm, but legislating speech restricts freedom of speech.
Allowing a select few to decide what is true is more dangerous than allowing free speech.
Free and open discussion is necessary for discovering truth.
The bill appears to regulate some platforms but exempts others, particularly politicians.
The real threat to democracy comes from politicians, not social media users.
Notable Quotes: Giving politicians the authority to decide what is truth, is like giving paedophiles permission to run a day care centre.
If this bill passes, don’t forget to also change the name of the ACMA to ‘The Ministry of Truth’.
